Module CamelotJava
Package com.storygraph

Class Graph

java.lang.Object
com.communication.UserInput<List<Edge>>
com.storygraph.Graph
public abstract class Graph extends UserInput<List<Edge>>
An object of this class represents a story graph
Author:
Alireza Shirvani

  • Method Details

    • getNodeBuilder

      protected abstract NodeBuilder getNodeBuilder()
      Write a new class that extends NodeBuilder. In that class, write down a method for each node that adds Camelot actions to execute when visiting that node. Those methods must have a BuilderMethod annotation.
      Returns:
      An instance of a class extending NodeBuilder that sets the actions sequences of each node.

    • getEdgeBuilder

      protected abstract NodeBuilder getEdgeBuilder()
      Write a new class that extends NodeBuilder. In that class, write down a method for each node that adds the edges of that node. Those methods must have a BuilderMethod annotation.
      Returns:
      An instance of a class extending NodeBuilder that sets the edges of each node.

    • traverse

      public Node traverse() throws Exception
      This method first executes the action sequence corresponding to the current node. It then enables and disables player choices based on the outgoing edges of the current node and waits for the player to make a choice. After a choice is made, it returns the next node of the graph following the edge that corresponds to that choice.
      Returns:
      After the player makes a choice, follows the corresponding edge and returns the node at the end of that edge.
      Throws:
      Exception - Throws an exception if the map does not contain an action sequence for the current node. It also It throws an exception if the action sequence fails to execute completely.

    • enableNewChoices

      private void enableNewChoices(List<Edge> choices) throws Exception
      Executes an action sequence that enables the player choices specified by choices.
      Parameters:
      choices - This list specifies what player choices need to be enabled at the current node.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • disablePreviousChoices

      private void disablePreviousChoices(List<Edge> choices) throws Exception
      Executes an action sequence that disables the player choices that were enabled in the previous node.
      Parameters:
      choices - This list specifies what player choices were enabled in the previous node.
      Throws:
      Exception
